intro: Apodanthera linearis, commonly known as the slender sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows from a caudex, a thickened stem base that stores water, allowing it to survive in drought conditions. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a dense, flattened cluster, and bloom during the rainy season. Apodanthera linearis is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to high sunlight exposure.
